original_extractions.chunk_text: The main urinary biomarkers identified were malvidin-3-glucoside, caffeic acid ethyl ester, and quercetin-3-glucuronide.
extracted_compounds: Based on the given text, the wine biomarkers and metabolites found in urine after wine consumption are:

These compounds are likely derived from the polyphenols present in wine, such as anthocyanins (malvidin-3-glucoside) and phenolic acids (caffeic acid ethyl ester). Quercetin-3-glucuronide is a metabolite of quercetin, a flavonoid found in various plant-based foods, including grapes.

original_extractions.chunk_text: Analysis revealed significant levels of resveratrol and its metabolites in urine samples.

document_only_extractions.chunk_text: The main urinary biomarkers identified were malvidin-3-glucoside, caffeic acid ethyl ester, and quercetin-3-glucuronide.
Analysis revealed significant levels of resveratrol and its metabolites in urine samples.
Phenolic compounds including gallic acid, protocatechuic acid, and vanillic acid were detected.
The study identified anthocyanins such as cyanidin-3-glucoside and peonidin-3-glucoside as key biomarkers.
Mass spectrometry analysis detected various sulfate and glucuronide conjugates of wine polyphenols.
